metadata.title: CVE-2024-27017 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nft_set_pipapo: walk over current view on netlink dump Thegeneration mask can be updated while netlink dump is in progress. Thepipapo set backend walk iterator cannot rely on it to infer what view ofthe datastructure is to be used. Add notation to specify if user wants toread/update the set. Based on patch from Florian Westphal.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
